paragraphs.name: abf5
paragraphs.text: In a sense, AIs are a little like alien intelligences, right now, here on Earth. The only intelligence we really understand so far is human intelligence. But inevitably every example we see of it shares all the details of the human condition and of human history. So what is intelligence like when it doesn’t share those details?

If aliens show up on Earth, one of the obvious big questions is: why are you here? What is your purpose? It’s something the characters in Arrival talk about a lot. And when Christopher and I were visiting the set we were asked to make a list of possible answers, that could be put on a whiteboard or a clipboard. Here’s what we came up with:
paragraphs.name: e2e7

paragraphs.text: Christopher was well aware that code shown in movies often doesn’t make sense (a favorite, regardless of context, seems to be the source code for nmap.c in Linux). But he wanted to create code that would make sense, and would actually do the analyses that would be going on in the movie.
paragraphs.name: 0b44

paragraphs.text: Software development — or at least language development — also has some structural similarities to movie making. One starts from a script — an overall specification of what one wants the finished product to be like. Then one actually tries to build it. Then, inevitably, at the end when one looks at what one has, one realizes one has to change the specification. In movies like Arrival, that’s post-production. In software, it’s more an iteration of the development process.
paragraphs.name: a8d4

ee50b76f2651.title: I love and agree with the idea of space-time being essentially nodes and edges.

paragraphs.text: I love and agree with the idea of space-time being essentially nodes and edges. To me it’s the most logical conclusion, if only because it’s hard to conceive of how it could be deconstructed any further and still maintain conceptual cohesion. I suspect we need a language that can encapsulate this with high resolution notions of dynamic looped, and…
paragraphs.name: 30be

paragraphs.text: Wouldn’t it just be easier for aliens to sort of pull out their wallets and show us their family vacation photos? Maybe we’re trying to over-abstractify first contact. If they’ve developed interstellar spacecraft, surely they’ve thought through how they will communicate with us. It’s likely this wouldn’t be their first rodeo. Maybe it went terribly…

paragraphs.text: What an epic article. Better than the decent movie it references and supports.
